meanings.definition: To make a solemn promise or undertaking.
meanings.sent1: She pled to always be there for her best friend.
meanings.sent2: He pled to help his neighbor with gardening every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The cat pled to catch all the mice in the house, but ended up napping instead.
meanings.sent4: The sun pled to shine brightly through the storm clouds.
meanings.sent5: The child pled to never forget the magic of childhood.

meanings.definition: To give as security for the performance of an act.
meanings.sent1: He pled his favorite toy as collateral for borrowing a book.
meanings.sent2: She pled her bike as security for borrowing her friend's skateboard.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel pled its acorn as a guarantee for safe passage through the garden.
meanings.sent4: The moon pled its light to guide the lost travelers through the night.
meanings.sent5: The tree pled its shade to shelter the weary travelers from the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: To promise to give (something) to someone.
meanings.sent1: She pled to donate her old clothes to the charity.
meanings.sent2: He pled to offer his assistance to anyone in need.
meanings.sent3: The bakery pled to provide free bread to the hungry mice in the field.
meanings.sent4: The river pled to share its water with the thirsty animals in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The garden pled to yield its fruits to the hungry villagers.
